availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Ohio
County of Clermont } SS

I, P. J. Nichols of New Richmond Clermont County Ohio do solemnly swore that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties pertaining to my office as commissioner of Deeds & other writings in the the state of Ohio for the state of Kentucky during all the term thereof
In witness whereof I have hereunto subscribed my name this 1st day of November A D 1865
Sworn to and Subscribed before me a Justice of the Peace, duly authorized to administer oaths in and for said county and state

In Witness whereof I have herunto set my hand and seal this 1st day of November A D 1865
C. W. Short J. P.

Comr of Deeds
Ohio
Oath of Perry J. Nichols
filed 3rd Nov/65
